title.narrative: Bangladesh Modern Food Storage Facilities Project

description.narrative: The overall Project development objective is to increase the grain reserve available to households to meet their post-disaster needs and improve the efficiency of grain storage management.

participating-org.narrative: Directorate General of Food, Ministry of Food

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Environment & Social Safeguards | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the project is carried out inaccordance with the provisions of the ESAMF, the ESIAs, the EMPs, and, if applicable, the SMPs and the RAPs. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Governance and Accountability Action Plan (GAAP) | Description :The Recipient will ensure that GAAP isimplemented properly according to the conditions and agreed scope, in particular, its provisions related to: (a) information andpublic disclosure; (b) social accountability and third party monitoring; and (c) establishment of a Procurement Panel withcomposition and ToRs acceptable to the Bank for carrying out procurement-related actions under the project. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Project Management Unit | Description :The Recipient will maintain the Project Management Unit (PMU) under DGFood and the Project Steering Committee (PSC) with composition, staff, functions, and resources satisfactory to IDA. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS
Implementation ArrangementsThe Recipient shall carry out the Project in accordance with the Implementation Arrangements set outin Section I, Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement.

title.narrative: P3. Reduction in grain storage and handling losses in public storage facilities
A2. Public food grain silo constructed and operational
B1. CSDs and LSDs connected to a centralized public food storage and distribution management system
B2. Research papers completed and approved by FPMU
C1. Client days of training provided by gender
B3. Policy notes prepared under the Food Policy Reasearch Program published
P1. Increased grain storage capacity in public and household storage facilities
A3. Households provided with safe grain storage containers
C2. People living in the adjacent areas of steel silos are aware and satisfied with the presence and benefits of steel silos
A6. Contractor workforce received training on Gender-Based Violence/ SEA (percentage of total contractor workforce)
A5. Targeted beneficiaries satisfied with the household silos
A4. Percentage women employed in construction of steel silos (relative to total labor force employed)
